quantum

Class BitUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • quantum.BitUtils

  • public class BitUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    The BitUtils class houses commonly used methods that involve the bits of an int

      BitUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • log2

        public static int log2(int n)
        Calculates the log base 2 of a number rounded up. This is equivalent to the amount of bits in that number.
        Parameters:
        n - an int
        Returns:
        the amount of bits required to represent n without padding

      • toBooleanArray

        public static boolean[] toBooleanArray(int state,
                                       int length)
        Creates a boolean array of a specified length that with the bits of a given int, starting with the least significant bit. This is intended to make the nth index of the return value to be the nth bit of the state. This method will ignore any bits beyond the length that .
        Parameters:
        state - value to be put into the array
        length - length of the array to be created.
        Returns:
        a boolean array representation of the bits of state.

      • bit

        public static boolean bit(int state,
                          int location)
        Tests for a specified bit of an int
        Parameters:
        state - the value to be checked.
        location - the bit index of the value to be checked.
        Returns:
        the bit of the value at the location, as a boolean

      • toInt

        public static int toInt(boolean[] given)
        Reads a boolean[] as bits and creates an int. The first index of the boolean[] is the least significant of the int. This is intended to have the nth bit of the resultant to be equivalent to the nth index in the array.
        Parameters:
        given - the bits of a number, starting with the least significant
        Returns:
        an integer representation with the specified bits

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(boolean[] given)
        Creates a binary string representation of a boolean[]. Ex: [true, true, false] -> 3 -> "011"
        Parameters:
        given - the bits of the binary value, starting with the least significant bit
        Returns:
        The binary String, starting with the most significant bit

      • insertBit

        public static int insertBit(int state,
                            int location,
                            boolean value)
        Inserts a bit into an int, shifting the most significant bits in order to fit the new value. This has the effect of keeping the least significant location-1 bits the same, adding a new bit value, and shifting the remaining most significant bits over by 1.
        Parameters:
        state - int value in which the bit should be inserted.
        location - bit index where the bit should be inserted.
        value - bit value to be inserted into the int
        Returns:
        the int with the inserted bit.

      • buildInt

        public static int buildInt(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Integer> bitmap,
                           int length)
        Initializes an int with bits according to a specified function, and with a given amount of bits.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - function for which the bits of the int will be determined. The Integer in this predicate is the bit index, and test should specify whether the bit at this index is 1.
        length - amount of bits to be included in the int. Any possible bits that the bitmap would respond true to beyond this point are ignored
        Returns:
        the int with bits as specified by the function.
